title: Anyone else really miss team builder?
body:
seriously, i miss being able to try new champions/oddball picks in a enviourment where you knew your team was ok with it, no matter the quere time.

now, such a thing is incredibly rare, and i dare say almost impossible.

still dont get why they removed it

replies.body:
It's no use.
We posted hundreds of this kind of threads when it's firstly removed, and we got thousands of replies and upvotes.
But Riot will never give a fuck.
90%of the changes they made in this season is just screwing this game further more, so I don't really expect them to do anything smart anymore.
Just because something receives a lot of support doesn't mean it makes sense. There's little to no difference between normal dynamicQ and teambuilder.

I'll just start off saying I actually enjoy dynamicQ.

However the simple fact that we are forced to play either blind pick (full of instalockers or trolls) or dynamicQ proves we need Teambuilder again.

Look at it from this point of view with an example: Aurelion Sol is coming out and you really want to play him. I mean, why wouldn't you? It's a new champ that just got released. But hey, people are banning him every other game in dynamicQ draft. Oh, he's not banned? Nevermind you're not in the top 2 picks, someone else will pick it before you, be it your teammate or the enemy team. This happened WAY too often when Jhin was released and I'm sure it will happen again with Aurelion Sol. 
Why do people even ban a new champion upon release? I don't care if he is OP or unhealthy, he has literally just gotten released and players should have the **right** to play him. At least they could back in the teambuilder days ;)

How is this fair for someone that wants to play the new champion? 

Or you could try going into blind pick but unlucky, your internet is too slow, or your computer is, and you never get to call the lane you want. And when you do, guess what happens? Someone instalocks the champion you were really looking forward to play. 
Now do you dodge? Do you play and pray you can play what you wish the next game? And what if it happens again? You can see where I'm going with this.

Now tell me again how there's no difference between dynamicQ and teambuilder?

For banning of new champs, that is usually people don't want to be forced to deal with such an unknown entity until they feel they understand him and/or his numbers have been brought to a safer level.
For those that are dying to play the new champ there is always customs and trying bot after bot match till you can pick him faster then the others in the que. In short, no real difference in a chance to pick him no matter where you go. The old mode was no different. Ya had to Instalok faster then the other guys on your own team.
How are you supposed to understand him if you go out of your way to make sure you never see him?

Like I said, Bots and Customs.
When you play as the champ (or have a friend play as them) in an easy testing field then you can get the first steps to a defense plan in your head. It's basic training before the real thing. That way when you finally face someone playing him in an actual pvp you already have the first building blocks of a counterattack forming in your mind.
Think back to when Illaoi first came out. People went into matches with her not knowing what he tentacles did even though Riot spoke about her kit and the Champion Spotlight was out. Why? Because they did not read the news on the champ and went in completely blind.

Except Sol isn't nearly half as weird as Illaoi. The swirly star things hurt. The bigger swirly star thing hurts MORE the bigger it gets. When the earlier stars move, they hurt that area instead. When he blasts energy out of his mouth, that hurts too. Congratulations, you just learned everything you need to know from seeing him in bots.

I've faced him ingame before; consider him similar to Vel'Koz in that he'll require some mechanical practice in a bot game to get the hang of using his abilities, but as far as playing alongside him or against him, he's stupidly simple; probably the easiest champion to deal with mechanically speaking in the game. Every surprise he could throw at you, every trick he could pull... the only way I see to learn about them is to face real live people playing him. And so long as you continue to ban him you will continue to remain ignorant of how to play against him until that final day down the road when one slips through and faces you and you have no clue what to do.

I forgot about that. In Dynamic, I can't find one team that doesn't have people belittling others. In TB, I find the occasional all mid vs regular team comps. (We slaughtered that enemy team, btw. It was fun and unexpected. I played a Kassadin.)

Canceling TB and Dominion and Solo Queue were all tactics to funnel more people into "Dynamic Queue" so Riot could fudge the numbers and then say, "Hey look! We have record breaking queues, matches and a faster paced game. This was a total success!" But when anything becomes "fast" it also loses "quality." Which is why the game is in the shitter atm imo.

I played TB exclusively. Didn't care that I've been Silver for 4 seasons and wasn't honestly interested in ranked. I gave up on that in S4. I played TB because it was hella relaxed, hella fun and it was always a good fun game no matter what kind of weird shit people would try.

Now, I play SMITE, it's different, it's fun (imo anyways) and the toxicity is for sure almost non-exisistant compared to League. I keep up with the League boards, just to maybe see a glimmer of hope of a time lost. I seriously doubt it will ever be a "great" game again. They've lost touch with the community and honestly their egos have blown way out of proportion.

It was a hella good 5 years for me personally playing League. I've queued up a few times only to get half way through it and just change my mind.

Riot puts me in mind of another game company Mythic Entertainment. They had the best RvR game out, Dark Age of Camelot, but instead of focusing on their selling point (RvR, Realm vs Realm) they focused all their efforts in trying to compete with WoW PvE. When DAoC started putting all their focus into PvE (which they horribly sucked at and failed miserably) their RvR became mundane and flat and people just left the game like a ghost town. If Riot isn't careful, they will repeat exactly what Mythic did long ago.

It's a shame really. Companies just never seem to learn anything. Sure, you can do a shitty job for cheap, but eventually, people will start paying more for a better quality job.

Teambuilder had a significant reason to exist.  It offered something no other queue system has so far which was Informed Consent.  By the time you got to matchmaking with teambuilder, you had agreed to the champions and roles your team was playing.  Don't want to play with Teemo support?  Then don't.  Only want mid lane mages with strong teamfighting?  Ok, be willing to wait and you can get that.  Want to run 5 champions with globals and all take teleport?  Ok, be prepared to camp out and bring a friend or two to start the queue but yea, you could do that.

agreed. why should we be forced to play with people who are playing something we think is stupid, while on the other hand why should we have to deal with people queue dodging, and resetting a 3 minute process if we want to play something weird?
As a support main... I really REALLY hate the new system because as much as I like playing support, I don't like playing it EVERY SINGLE GAME.

As a dedicated Mid/Support player, (which has become pure support at this point), I really miss teambuilder. I just got {{champion:63}} and want to practice him, but so far I've only been able to play him as a support unless I go to bots; and by playing against bots I can't learn too much.
Teambuilder was great.
i know that feeling. im also a sup/mid player and over the past 20 games i have gotten mid 3 times.... i hate it.

I doubt there was a lot of people using it for this reason, thus there was little point in supporting it.  The new queue system looks after the overwhelming reason for people using Team Builder anyways.  We can choose our roles now.
